page.title: 14Ashford Farm,Ashford C.
page.content: We arrived at Ashford Farm at 7.45 a.m., when the cows were still being milked. She had started milking at 5.30 a.m.The milk from the cows goes first to a glass jar and then in a big tank to keep it cool untill the milk tanker comes to collect it.The tanker came about 10.45 a.m. and took the milk to Cadburys.When the milking was over, everything had to be washed down properly.When the cows had all been milked they were let out in the field to graze.They used an electric fence to control the amount of grass the cows eat and to stop them trampling the grass.Then Mr Tudge did some odd jobs around the farm.The cowsheds were cleaned out.We went back to the farm at 3.00 p.m.We saw Mr. Tudge artificially inseminating a Fresian cow.He used semen from a
